meanings.definition: To force someone out of a position or place.
meanings.sent1: The principal ousted the troublemaker from the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The board ousted the corrupt official from his role.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was ousted from the bird feeder by a determined blue jay.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds ousted the sun from the sky, casting a shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the fire alarm ousted all other sounds in the building.

meanings.definition: To remove someone from power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The rebels ousted the dictator from his oppressive rule.
meanings.sent2: The shareholders ousted the CEO due to financial mismanagement.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was ousted from the tree branch by a gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: The new technology ousted the old methods, revolutionizing the industry.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the painting ousted the dullness of the room, bringing life to the space.
